answers.answer: Asylum is a form of protection that allows a foreigner who cannot return to their country of origin to remain in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Any foreigner who left their country of origin due to fear of persecution, serious human rights violations, or armed conflict can apply for asylum.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Someone initiates an asylum application by asking for it either in writing or verbally.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: After applying, asylum seekers receive a form, submit documents, and get a temporary identity document. They are then scheduled for preliminary and secondary interviews by the General Inspectorate for Immigration, which evaluates and resolves the application.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: An asylum seeker cannot be deported to their country of origin and receives a temporary identity document. Additionally, everything they say during interviews is confidential.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Asylum applications in Romania are normally processed within one to two months.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Seeking asylum is necessary for foreigners who left their country of origin due to fear of persecution, serious human rights violations, or armed conflict.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: An asylum application can be submitted directly at a border crossing point or, if already in Romania, anywhere within the country. It cannot be applied for from outside Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Sprijin de Urgență provides resources, food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: Individuals can request support from Sprijin de Urgență by using the 'Request or provide resources' option.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: Someone can offer resources such as food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteer services through Sprijin de Urgență by using the 'Request or provide resources' option.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: The main purpose of Un Acoperiș is to provide support in finding temporary accommodation or to offer space to help vulnerable people arriving in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.

answers.answer: Un Acoperiș helps by providing support to individuals who need to find temporary accommodation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.

answers.answer: To access support from Un Acoperiș, individuals need to 'Access Un Acoperiș!' and then they can search for accommodation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.

answers.answer: People can provide housing options via Un Acoperiș by offering a space to help vulnerable people and using the 'offer accommodation' option after accessing Un Acoperiș.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.
